a.title: Apr 28 update: remote learning still in place & end of year programs being planned

div.a: Apr 28 update: remote learning still in place & end of year programs being planned
div.div: Just a reminder that the order for schools to practice Remote Learning and social distancing is still in place. Also, End of year ceremonies and celebrations are being planned by our administrators.
CHS athletes are asked turn in their athletic equipment and uniforms that were previously checked out to you, according to the following schedule.

a.title: Additional guidance from TEA about Governor's Executive Orders

div.a: Additional guidance from TEA about Governor's Executive Orders
div.div: While the Governor’s decision continues the closure of school buildings for in-person classroom attendance for the duration of the 2019-20 school year, it in no way ends at-home instructional support for Texas’s millions of students.

a.title: April 17 update - schools to continue in remote learning through end of academic year

div.a: April 17 update - schools to continue in remote learning through end of academic year
div.div: Schools will remain closed to in-person classroom attendance through the end of the 2019-2020 academic year.

a.title: Meals distributed Mondays, Wednesdays and Fridays

div.a: Meals distributed Mondays, Wednesdays and Fridays
div.div: Meals continue to be distributed on Mondays, Wednesdays, and Fridays.

a.title: R.S.V.P. for Kindergarten 2020-2021 (if not already enrolled in Pre-K)

div.a: R.S.V.P. for Kindergarten 2020-2021 (if not already enrolled in Pre-K)
div.div: Parents can R.S.V.P. by submitting an online form, or by turning in a printable form to the Calhoun County ISD District Office.

a.title: Grades updated in Google Classroom & Grade Book

div.a: Grades updated in Google Classroom & Grade Book
div.div: Parents, thank you for your help during our first weeks of remote learning. Teachers have updated grades in both Google Classroom and Grade Book.
Parents can R.S.V.P by submitting an online form, or by turning in a printable form to the Calhoun County ISD District Office.

a.title: CHS short film featured at the Victoria TX Independent Film Festival

div.a: CHS short film featured at the Victoria TX Independent Film Festival
div.div: CHS students produced a short film that will be featured at the Victoria, TX Independent Film Festival.

a.title: April 3 update: New meal distribution site added in Olivia/Port Alto area

div.a: April 3 update: New meal distribution site added in Olivia/Port Alto area
div.div: Starting Monday, April 6, a new meal distribution site will be added in the Olivia/Port Alto area:

span.br:
Welcome to Calhoun County Independent School District (CCISD).
We have much to be proud of!

p.span: Our campuses are located in the beautiful coastal communities of Port Lavaca, Seadrift and Port O’Connor. Our assets include award-winning academics, meaningful extracurricular activities, outstanding teachers and staff, committed parents and students, supportive community, dedicated volunteers and strategic partnerships. CCISD is recognized for financial integrity and transparency. Additionally, all campuses “met standard,” which is the highest accountability rating from the Texas Educational Association.

strong.span: We hope you decide to be part of our pride!
